hero.title: We are experts from /n large companies /n *(BigTech).*
body: We get together to share our experience, views and insights that can help tech startups to easier navigate the deep water of legal issues.
We have extensive experience of advising tech companies on different legal matters occurring during companies lives, and we will be happy if our experience will help you to approach legal questions.

howItWorks.title: How it works

body.title: Analysis
body.body: We contact you if necessary to clarify the details of your request.

body.title: Meet with a mentor
body.body: You have a mentoring session. Each session lasts one hour. You can have up to 2 sessions per request.

howItWorks.disclaimer: This is a pro bono mentorship project, we do not provide legal services such as advising on transactions, drafting documents or representing your company in a court. Before making any decision, you are always advised to get legal advice or consultation.

items.title: Love for technology and innovation
items.body: We believe that technology is changing the world for the better and opens new horizons for the people’s development and growth, that’s why we love it and want to support companies driving positive changes through the technology-based solutions.

items.title: Honesty and open dialog
items.body: We know that sometimes our expertise, background or other circumstances make it difficult or impossible for us to deal with certain matter. We will always tell you, if we cannot help. We also appreciate open feedback on our cooperation.

items.title: Curiosity
items.body: We are fascinated by learning new things, be it's an innovative technology, a new business model, or a new approach to regulation.

items.title: Love for the work we do
items.body: We are real fans of our work! It is important for us to grow and develop professionally, to invest in development of the highest professional standards and strive to be reliable business partners and role models for future generations of lawyers.

items.title: Eagerness to share knowledge
items.body: We want to create a common space where anyone can benefit from the knowledge and experience of others. We believe that such space can be a source of support and inspiration for both: those who share, and those who seek for advice.

mentors.title: Our mentors
mentors.body: Meet our mentors! Our mentors are industry leaders, seasoned legal practitioners, and professionals who are passionate about sharing their knowledge and helping you succeed.

mentors.name: Tatiana Murzabaeva
mentors.expertise: E-commerce | Business Operations | Compliance | Consumer Protection
experience: Tatiana leads the business operations and regulatory affairs legal team at *Joom*, ensuring compliance across all operational countries (with a primary focus on the EU and CIS regions).

She provides comprehensive legal support for the marketplace, facilitates the launch of new business units, and champions the platform’s participation in initiatives like the *EU Product Safety and Consumer Protection Pledges*.

Tatiana’s expertise includes e-commerce regulations, product safety, consumer protection compliance, and cross-border and domestic litigation. Her previous roles encompass managing legal support for international logistics IT solutions at *Joom Logistics*, overseeing legal matters for Eastern European operations at retailer *Kingfisher*, and serving as a dispute resolution associate at international legal firm *Baker McKenzie*.

Tatiana excels in translating complex regulatory matters into actionable insights for business leaders, ensuring smooth and fast business growth while maintaining compliance and operational integrity.
mentors.education: National Research University — Higher School of Economics

mentors.name: Kamil Egelev
mentors.expertise: Privacy Law | Data Protection | IT law | Data Privacy | Privacy Compliance | Privacy Due Diligence
experience: Kamil is a seasoned privacy compliance leader *(IAPP CIPM, CIPP/E)* and qualified lawyer.
He has *over 14 years of experience* in the legal profession, both in law firms and as in-house counsel for a tech giant.

Worked with fintech, e-commerce, advertising, ride-hailing, food-tech, transportation, ed tech, e-health businesses, consulting on IT/IP, privacy and data protection issues in multiple countries *(EU, US, CIS)*.
Supported companies during on-site audits of data protection authorities for good outcome. Excelled in simplifying privacy compliance.

mentors.name: Mariet Mezokh
mentors.expertise: IP Law | Commercial law | Acceleration programs | FinTech | Digital products development
experience: Mariet is an expert specialising in IP and legal support of digital products.

Her main projects include *MTS StartUp Hub acceleration and partnerships program* (2020-2024), *UGC-platform NUUM* (2023-2024) applications store (2022-2024). Mariet has also acted as IP practice independent advisor at *Infralex* and as operations manager of a UK funded *NGO*.
Her experience combines support of digital products for Retail companies *(IKEA, Magnit)* and *Telecom industry (MTS)*.
mentors.education: University of Oxford, Kuban State University

mentors.name: Lina Gevorgyan
mentors.expertise: IP | Copyright | User & Content Safety | Dispute Resolution
experience: Lina is an expert specialising in content and media services.

She is skilled in content protection, user safety, IP and dispute resolution. She worked for *Yandex*, *TikTok*, *UGC-platform NUUM*. Lina has also established legal department for *WebKontrol Ltd*. from the ground up and implemented there functional and management processes.
Her experience combines proactive risk assessment and mitigation with extensive court practice.
mentors.education: Geneva University, Moscow State Law Academy (MSAL)

mentors.name: Aleksandra Skiba
mentors.expertise: Legal operations | Legal management | Contract management | Legal tech
experience: Aleksandra Skiba is a partner at *playbooq.com*, specializing in legal process outsourcing, operations, and digital transformation for startups.
With *over 10 years of experience*, she focuses on  building and enhancing back-office processes.
Previously, she held positions at *inDrive*, *Vivid Money*, *OZON.ru*, and others.
mentors.education: Queen Mary University of London, National Research University — Higher School of Economics

mentors.name: Ekaterina Kazmina
mentors.expertise: IT law | Antitrust | Compliance | Dispute resolution | M&A | Government Relations | ESG
experience: Ekaterina Kazmina is leading a legal department for the non-profit arm of the international mobility and urban services platform *inDrive*. In this role Ekaterina develops and implements the division's legal strategy to ensure compliance with the applicable legislation, including laws regulating sports events, education, film festivals etc. Ekaterina provides legal support for online and offline projects in multiple regions, including *Central Asia, LATAM and Africa*.

Ekaterina’s most recent places of work also include *Yandex* where she worked for five years leading multiple legal projects in the spheres of antitrust, platform regulation, corporate and civil law, insider trading and compliance. Ekaterina also used to work as a *Senior Lecturer* at the Higher School of Economics teaching the master’s course Antitrust in Digital Economy.
Ekaterina has an extensive expertise in the IT sector, having supported such types of digital services as search engines, ride-hailing and streaming platforms, classifieds, marketplaces, and others.
mentors.education: National Research University — Higher School of Economics

mentors.name: Natasha Orlova
mentors.position: AI, IP law, contract law and data protection
mentors.expertise: AI | IP | Contract law | Data protection
experience: Natasha is an expert with *10+ years* of international legal experience in information technology, IP and contract law.

She worked for *Yandex, Philips and Booking.com*. She also supported a tech start-up *PortXchange* (a subsidiary of the Port of Rotterdam) as a sole legal counsel where she deployed privacy policies and practices and established legal processes.
Her experience combines the knowledge of the legal and business practices in *the Netherlands and Russia*.
mentors.education: Tilburg University, Financial University under the Government of the Russian Federation

mentors.name: Elena Mazetova
mentors.position: Global regulatory compliance and corporate governance
mentors.expertise: IT law | Compliance | M&A and corporate governance | Global regulatory policy | Dispute Resolution
experience: Elena is highly experienced legal practitioner with a diverse professional background in large IT companies and law firms with key focus on dispute resolution, M&A/corporate law, compliance and international/cross-border regulation. She is also advising companies on full scope legal support of IT business, including launches in foreign regions in part related to evaluation of legal risks, development of contractual structures, conducting negotiations, etc.

She held the position of *Vice President of Legal at inDrive* (global international mobility and urban services platform), and also worked at *Ozon* (one of the leading e-commerce platforms in Russia) and *Yandex* (biggest Russian IT company operating most popular search engine), where she participated in various landmark cases and high-profile transactions.

Elena is also lecturing at the National Research University Higher School of Economics and act as a mentor of the startup mentorship programs held by the *Aurora Tech Award* (worldwide prize for women tech founders) and *Underdog Tech Award* (An international prize for the best tech startups outside big tech hubs and communities)
mentors.education: Saïd Business School University of Oxford; Queen Mary University of London; National Research University - Higher School of Economics

mentors.name: Tatiana Novikova
mentors.expertise: Educational law | Advertising law | Contracts | International payment processing
experience: Tatiana is an expert in structuring and managing the legal function of *international educational start-ups* (US, LATAM, UK, Russia, Israel, Indonesia, Malaysia), including licensing and compliance in the educational field.
Tatiana is also an expert in advertising and marketing law. Tatiana was a head of Marketing and Advertising Legal Practice in *Ozon* (one of the leading marketplaces in Russia and CIS).

Tatiana has extensive experience in *cloud and infrastructure services*. She was a leading counsel for the launch of an advertising data operator (ADO) to provide storage, recording, and transmission of advertising data.

Through her work, she managed and assisted with connecting all *Yandex* group projects to international payment processing and acquiring services (Stripe, PayPal) in several foreign jurisdictions (USA, UIA, South America, Switzerland, etc.).
Tatiana's experience helps businesses identify risks, assess them, and mitigate them in the most beneficial way for the business.
mentors.education: KU Leuven, Belgium, Financial University under the Government of the RF, Russian State University for Humanities (RGGU)

mentors.name: Vladimir Bagaev
mentors.position: Legal practice and IT project management
mentors.expertise: Leadership in Digital Transformation | Entrepreneurship in Legal and IT Sectors | Online Platform Development | Legal Tech and Digitalisation
experience: Vladimir has a rich background in both legal practice and IT project management. In 2008-2010, he worked at *KPMG* in Moscow, where, as a senior consultant, he advised clients on international transactions and the establishment of new ventures across various jurisdictions.

In 2010, Vladimir founded *Zakon.ru*, which has grown to become one of Russia's most popular legal websites and a central hub for the country's legal community. This platform showcases Vladimir's hands-on experience in building and managing a successful IT project. His expertise spans the legal, organisational, and technological aspects crucial for the development and operation of online platforms.
Currently serving as the *Development Director at Zakon Publishing*, Vladimir continues to influence the digital landscape of legal resources.
mentors.education: University of Oxford, Saint Petersburg State University

incognito.name: Your name is here...
incognito.subtitle: Do you want to become a mentor?

dialog.title: Join as a mentor
dialog.body: To become a mentor in our project, you will need at least one reference from our current mentors, as well as confirmation of relevant experience.
dialog.contact: For more details please contact us:

about.label: Tell us about your startup
about.placeholder: Describe what you do, your location, etc.

goal.label: What do you want to discuss with a mentor?
goal.placeholder: Describe your challenges and questions you would like to discuss with mentor.

preference.label: Preferred mentor
preference.placeholder: If you have a preference, please specify.

successMessage.title: Request Sent Successfully!
successMessage.body: We've received your request and will get back to you soon.

joinAsMentor.title: Join as a mentor:
joinAsMentor.body: To become a mentor in our project, you will need at least one reference from our current mentors, as well as confirmation of relevant experience. For more details please contact us: <email>atwisementors@gmail.com<email>.
